fixes.name: wc_pi

fixes.name: wc_percentage
fixes.solution_explanation: Mapped WINDOW_MAX(MAX([Percentage])) to a measure that returns the maximum of the calculated column 'Percentage' over the selected window using ALLSELECTED and MAXX.
fixes.type_changed_reason: WINDOW_MAX is a Tableau table calculation (window aggregation), so this must be implemented as a measure in DAX.

fixes.name: Index
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR idx = RANKX(ALLSELECTED('Sheet1 (radial_bar_chart_data)'), 'Sheet1 (radial_bar_chart_data)'[Order], , ASC, DENSE)
RETURN (idx - 1) * 2
fixes.solution_explanation: Tableau INDEX() is a table calculation (row position). Emulated the row index in DAX using RANKX over ALLSELECTED ordered by [Order], then applied the (INDEX()-1)*2 transformation.
fixes.type_changed_reason: INDEX() is a Tableau table calculation (row position); in Power BI it must be implemented as a measure (here approximated with RANKX to derive row position).

fixes.name: X
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR vIndex = [Index]
VAR v_wc_percentage = [wc_percentage]
VAR v_wc_pi = [wc_pi]
VAR v_wc_start = [wc_start]
RETURN
IF(
    vIndex < 270,
    SIN(vIndex * v_wc_percentage * v_wc_pi / 180) * v_wc_start,
    IF(
        vIndex > 270,
        SIN((540 - vIndex) * v_wc_percentage * v_wc_pi / 180) * (v_wc_start + 1),
        SIN((vIndex * v_wc_percentage + 3) * v_wc_pi / 180) * (v_wc_start + 0.5)
    )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the Tableau IF/ELSEIF/ELSE logic into nested IF statements in DAX. Referenced dependent measures ([Index], [wc_percentage], [wc_pi], [wc_start]) and used SIN with the same arithmetic, preserving the degree-to-radian conversion via multiplication by PI (wc_pi) and division by 180.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The calculation depends on Tableau table calculations (INDEX, WINDOW_MAX) and aggregations; per rules, it must be a measure in Power BI.
